com.xtructure.xsim
Interface XClock<F extends XTime.Phase<F>>

Type Parameters:
F - the type of phase of the time of this clock
All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<XClock<F>>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractXClock, StandardXClock
public interface XClock<F extends XTime.Phase<F>>
extends java.lang.Comparable<XClock<F>>

A simulation clock.

Version:
0.9.6
Author:
Peter Nürnberg

Method Detail

getTime

XTime<F> getTime()
Returns the current time.

Returns:
the current time

increment

XTime<F> increment()
Increments the time and returns the new value.

Incrementing the time will cause the time to advance to the next clock phase if possible. If the current time phase is the last available time phase, the tick will be incremented, and the phase will be reset to the first available time phase.

Returns:
the newly incremented time

setTime

void setTime(XTime<F> time)
Sets the current time.

Implementations may refuse to allow certain time manipulations, such as setting times with negative tick values, moving backwards in time, etc. In these cases, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
time - the time to which to set this clock
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given time is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given time is unacceptable
